timeline.bodyText: The inherited close() method throws IOException so this is fine to do
timeline.author: belugabehr

timeline.bodyText: out in this case is wraps arrayOut, and it has no buffering, so it does not need to be explicitly closed, or better, in the future, out should be closed only and arrayOut will be closed implicitly.  Anyway, I came to this conclusion because this is how close() is implemented in a couple of other Writer classes as well.
timeline.author: belugabehr

replies.bodyText: I would either close only arrayOut but with comments about what you have written here or close only out and catching the IOException that would never occur and comment in the catch block similarly.
